entities.name: skeeter
entities.description: Skeeter is mentioned as someone who took advantage of Bathilda, according to Doge. ("If that is so, it is even more dishonorable for Skeeter to have taken advantage of her")

entities.name: bathilda
entities.description: Bathilda is mentioned as someone who may have said something that cannot be relied upon, according to Doge. ("no reliance can be placed on anything Bathilda may have said!")

entities.name: rita skeeter
entities.description: Rita Skeeter is mentioned as someone who knows ways of bringing back memories. ("Oh, there are ways of bringing back memories, and I’m sure Rita Skeeter knows them all")

entities.name: auntie muriel
entities.description: Auntie Muriel is mentioned as someone who thinks Bathilda may have old photographs and letters. ("But even if Bathilda’s completely cuckoo, I’m sure she’d still have old photographs, maybe even letters")

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as someone who lived in Godric's Hollow. ("She knew the Dumbledores for years... The Dumbledores moved there after Percival was imprisoned")

entities.name: godric's hollow
entities.description: Godric's Hollow is mentioned as a location where Bathilda lives and the Dumbledores used to live. ("She’s been there forever! The Dumbledores moved there after Percival was imprisoned")

entities.name: percival
entities.description: Percival is mentioned as someone who was imprisoned, which led to the Dumbledores moving to Godric's Hollow. ("The Dumbledores moved there after Percival was imprisoned")

entities.name: barry
entities.description: Barry is mentioned as Harry's name, which Auntie Muriel uses to address him. ("Yes, Barry, that’s what I just said")

relationships.description: Skeeter took advantage of Bathilda, according to Doge. ("If that is so, it is even more dishonorable for Skeeter to have taken advantage of her")
Auntie Muriel thinks Bathilda may have old photographs and letters. ("But even if Bathilda’s completely cuckoo, I’m sure she’d still have old photographs, maybe even letters")
